references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a core concept that Resfusion builds upon and adapts for image restoration.
This work demonstrates the application of diffusion models to image super-resolution, providing a key example of applying the approach to image restoration tasks, which Resfusion extends.

references.paper_title: SNIPS: Solving noisy inverse problems stochastically
references.reason: This paper introduces SNIPS, an important method for solving inverse problems using stochastic techniques, offering a theoretical foundation relevant to Resfusion's approach.

references.paper_title: Inversion by direct iteration: An alternative to denoising diffusion for image restoration
references.reason: This recent work explores direct iteration methods for image restoration, providing a related approach which Resfusion contrasts and improves upon.
This paper introduces Residual Denoising Diffusion Models (RDDM), a closely related work that Resfusion directly addresses and improves upon by resolving several limitations.
